member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Used with theIOCTL_STORAGE_QUERY_PROPERTY control code to retrieve the storage adapter descriptor data for a device.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.Version
member.summary: Contains the size of this structure, in bytes. The value of this member will change as members are added to the structure.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.Size
member.summary: Specifies the total size of the data returned, in bytes. This may include data that follows this structure.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.MaximumTransferLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of bytes the storage adapter can transfer in a single operation.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.MaximumPhysicalPages
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of discontinuous physical pages the storage adapter can manage in a single transfer (in other words, the extent of its scatter/gather support).

summary.para: Specifies the storage adapter's alignment requirements for transfers. The alignment mask indicates alignment restrictions for buffers required by the storage adapter for transfer operations. Valid mask values are also restricted by characteristics of the memory managers on different versions of Windows.

listheader.description: Buffers must be aligned on BYTE boundaries.
Buffers must be aligned on WORD boundaries.
Buffers must be aligned on DWORD32 boundaries.
Buffers must be aligned on DWORD64 boundaries.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AdapterUsesPio
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter uses programmed I/O (PIO) and requires the use of system-space virtual addresses mapped to physical memory for data buffers. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter does not use PIO.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AdapterScansDown
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter scans down for BIOS devices, that is, the storage adapter begins scanning with the highest device number rather than the lowest. When this member isFALSE, the storage adapter begins scanning with the lowest device number. This member is reserved for legacy miniport drivers.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.CommandQueueing
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter supports SCSI tagged queuing and/or per-logical-unit internal queues, or the non-SCSI equivalent. When this member isFALSE, the storage adapter neither supports SCSI-tagged queuing nor per-logical-unit internal queues.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AcceleratedTransfer
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter supports synchronous transfers as a way of speeding up I/O. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter does not support synchronous transfers as a way of speeding up I/O.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusType
member.summary: Specifies a value of type that indicates the type of the bus to which the device is connected.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusMajorVersion
member.summary: Specifies the major version number, if any, of the storage adapter.

member.name: STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusMinorVersion
member.summary: Specifies the minor version number, if any, of the storage adapter.

summary.para: Specifies the SCSI request block (SRB) type used by the HBA.

listheader.description: The HBA uses SCSI request blocks.
The HBA uses extended SCSI request blocks.

summary.para: This member is valid starting with Windows 8.
Specifies the address type of the HBA.

listheader.description: The HBA uses 8-bit bus, target, and LUN addressing.

summary.para: This member is valid starting with Windows 8.
